facts: The Olympic Games began in ancient Greece about 2,700 years ago and were held in Olympia to honor the god Zeus.
A standard soccer match has two 45-minute halves, and the clock usually keeps running even when the ball is out of play.
In basketball, the shot clock limits how long a team can hold the ball before shooting, which keeps the game fast and fair.
Baseball pitchers can throw different pitches, like fastballs and curveballs, by changing grip and wrist motion to make the ball move in the air.
In tennis, the word "love" means zero points, and many people think it came from the French word "l'oeuf," meaning "egg."
A marathon is 26.2 miles long, a distance chosen after the 1908 London Olympics so the race could start at Windsor Castle and finish at the stadium.
The FIFA World Cup is held every four years and is one of the most-watched sporting events in the world.
